poem:
Title: "Pledges and Divisions"

Visas peeled, 
like ripe oranges
promises hurled,
in a political scrimmage.
Worry drones, 
in the fabric of economy.

Industry figures, siren crying,
in the tug-of-war
of arbitrary deciding.
Strains of voices unweeded,
in the garden of nation.

Sunak's pledge - a stone 
thrown across still waters.
Ripples of change,
unyielding promises,
Empty vessels of prosperity
echoing, 
beneath the tree of Farage.
